result.execSummary:
The defendant Josef A Marx was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bail applied to costs.  Balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
 Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed/sign releases.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Maintain full employment and/or combination of schooling.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber, non working hours, with standard release conditions.  STAYED  To be used at Agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Josef A Marx in court with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.  Stephen Joseph Centinario appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Counts #2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in.   State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Rosario makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:   

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

CONDITION TIME:   30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions- STAYED -  to be used at agent's discretion

**** Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.****

Defendant Josef A Marx in court with attorney J Anthony Rosario.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Rosario requests a jury trial date on 15CM909, other cases to follow. Court sets. Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Josef A Marx in court with Attorney J Anthony Rosario.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rosario requests an adjourned date as he has just met Defendant today.  Court adjourns.     Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions, including IID.

Defendant Josef A Marx in court with attorney Joseph Smith.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on July 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Defendant Josef A Marx not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court STAYS any Warrant.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant
